ai.summary: Exmouth Town Trail is an 8.2 km moderately challenging coastal walk in the UK, weaving from Exmouth town along the seafront and estuary with scenic views of the coast, harbour, and town landmarks. The route is suitable for most hikers with a moderate fitness level and offers a mix of paved promenade, seawall paths, and short stretches of gravel.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently undulating coastal paths and town pavements. Surfaces include paved promenades, seawall walkways, and occasional gravel or compact dirt sections. Expect some uneven patches and potential slipperiness when wet; steps may be present in older pedestrian areas.
ai.safety_notes: Carry water and a charged phone; wear appropriate footwear; be mindful of other pedestrians, cyclists, and dogs on shared paths; check tide times if you plan to include estuary sections; weather can change quickly along the coast, so dress in layers; daylight hours may vary by season.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or lightweight boots
Weather-appropriate clothing with layers and a waterproof jacket
Map or offline GPS/phone with map of the route
Small backpack and basic first aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October) is typically best for mild weather and coastal views; the trail can be enjoyed year-round with proper clothing and gear.

seo.title: Exmouth Town Trail – 8.2 km Moderate Coastal Walk in the UK
